lazarus_implementation_tools.models.batching module

class lazarus_implementation_tools.models.batching.Batcher(model_api: ModelAPI, file_path: list | str, prompt: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

A class for batching files and processing them using a specified model API.

get_files()[source]

Retrieves the list of files to process.

Returns:

A list of file paths.

run() → List[ModelAPI][source]

Runs the batching process by processing each file in a separate thread.

class lazarus_implementation_tools.models.batching.RunAndWait(model_api: ModelAPI)[source]

Bases: object

A class for running a model API request and waiting for the response.

This is currently highly opinionated towards firebase storage. TODO: Extend this object to use other storage systems.

run()[source]

Runs the send, wait, and save_file methods in sequence.

save_file()[source]

Saves the downloaded response file to the local filesystem.

send()[source]

Sends the model API request.

wait() → bool[source]

Waits for the response file to appear in Firebase.

Returns:

True if the file was successfully downloaded, False otherwise.

lazarus_implementation_tools.models.constants module

lazarus_implementation_tools.models.utils module

lazarus_implementation_tools.models.utils.query_rikai2(file_path: str | list, prompt: str, url: str | None = None, org_id: str | None = None, auth_key: str | None = None, webhook: str | None = None, return_file_name: str | None = None, advanced_explainability: bool | None = False, advanced_vision: bool | None = False, force_ocr: bool | None = False, verbose: bool | None = True) → List[ModelAPI][source]

Queries the Rikai2 model API for the given file path(s) and prompt.

Parameters:

  • file_path – The path to a single file or a list of file paths.

  • prompt – The prompt to pass to the Rikai2 model API.

  • url – Model url, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • org_id – Org ID for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • auth_key – Auth Key for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • webhook – Webhook url for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • return_file_name – The name you want to give the return file (No Extension), Optional defaults to FILENAME_MODEL

  • advanced_explainability – Whether to user advanced_explainability, Optional defaults to False

  • advanced_vision – Whether to user advanced_vision, Optional defaults to False

  • force_ocr – Whether to force ocr, Optional defaults to False

  • verbose – Whether to return verbose output, Optional defaults to True

lazarus_implementation_tools.models.utils.query_rikai_extract(file_path: str | list, prompt: str, url: str | None = None, org_id: str | None = None, auth_key: str | None = None, webhook: str | None = None, return_file_name: str | None = None, return_confidence: bool | None = True) → List[ModelAPI][source]

Queries the RikaiExtract model API for the given file path(s) and prompt.

Parameters:

  • file_path – The path to a single file or a list of file paths.

  • prompt – The prompt to pass to the RikaiExtract model API.

  • url – Model url, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • org_id – Org ID for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • auth_key – Auth Key for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • webhook – Webhook url for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • return_file_name – The name you want to give the return file (No Extension), Optional defaults to FILENAME_MODEL

  • return_confidence – Whether to return confidence scores, Optional defaults to True

lazarus_implementation_tools.models.utils.query_riky2(file_path: str | list, prompt: str, url: str | None = None, org_id: str | None = None, auth_key: str | None = None, webhook: str | None = None, return_file_name: str | None = None) → List[ModelAPI][source]

Queries the Riky2 model API for the given file path(s) and prompt.

Parameters:

  • file_path – The path to a single file or a list of file paths.

  • prompt – The prompt to pass to the Riky2 model API.

  • url – Model url, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • org_id – Org ID for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • auth_key – Auth Key for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • webhook – Webhook url for request, Optional defaults to environment file.

  • return_file_name – The name you want to give the return file (No Extension), Optional defaults to FILENAME_MODEL
